channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Massive storm and protests by sports stars threaten to overshadow Pence's RNC speech
RNC tries to close the gender gap on Night 3
Former Obama adviser: One of the most jarring scenes was the naturalization ceremony
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and David Axelrod react to the naturalization ceremony that President Donald Trump oversaw during the 2020 Republican National Convention.

item.title: 'Unsurvivable storm surge' threatens US as Laura explodes from Category 1 to 4 hurricane in 15 hours
See Laura's projected path in real-time storm tracker
Inside the company at the forefront of China's push to develop a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Inside the white, sterile walls of a new building on the southern outskirts of Beijing, two employees donning masks and rubber gloves are busy pipetting a clear, colorless liquid into rows of small vials.

item.title: New Zealand mosque terrorist sentenced to life in prison with no parole
item.description: A far-right terrorist who killed 51 Muslim worshipers in New Zealand's worst mass shooting in modern history will spend the rest of his life in prison with no chance of parole, the first time such a sentence has been handed down in the country's courts.

item.title: NBA postpones playoff games after players boycott to protest shooting
item.description: The NBA announced Wednesday it will postpone Game 5 of three different series in response to the Milwaukee Bucks decision to boycott their playoff game following the police shooting of Jacob Blake in the team's home state of Wisconsin.

item.title: Kenny Smith walks off 'Inside the NBA' set to show solidarity with protesting players
item.description: Kenny Smith, one of the hosts of Inside the NBA, walked off the set of the show on Wednesday night.

item.title: Teen arrested in fatal shooting at Wisconsin protest, police say
Second video of Jacob Blake's shooting surfaces
item.description: As a second video of the police shooting of Jacob Blake emerges, Blake family attorney reiterates that the use of deadly force towards Blake in front of his children was fully unjustified.

item.title: Sailor questioned over fire aboard USS Bonhomme Richard
item.description: A US sailor is being questioned over the possibility that they may have intentionally set a fire that caused extensive damage to the USS Bonhomme Richard at Naval Base San Diego last month, two US defense officials told CNN.

item.title: Hillary Clinton's dire warning to Joe Biden
item.description: Hillary Clinton has a bit of advice for Joe Biden come November 3: Don't even think about conceding if the election is at all close.

item.title: China says US U-2 spy plane disrupted its military exercises
item.description: Beijing has accused the US of sending a U-2 spy plane into a no-fly zone to "trespass" on live-fire exercises being conducted by China below.

item.title: Trump's former attorney says he helped the Falwells bury racy photos
item.description: The President's former fixer. A prominent evangelical couple. Allegations of blackmail and sexual indiscretions with a hotel pool attendant.

item.title: NATO allies inch toward possible military confrontation
item.description: Tension is simmering in the waters of the Eastern Mediterranean as Greece and Turkey, NATO allies but historic rivals, inch toward a possible military confrontation that could end up engulfing the region.

item.title: Fauci says he was in surgery when new CDC testing guidelines were discussed
Moderna shares new vaccine data
Sexual assault survivors face jail in Australia if they publicly identify themselves under new law
item.description: Sexual assault victims who publicly discuss their experiences using their real names could face up to four months in prison, under a new law passed in the Australian state of Victoria, sparking outrage among campaigners.

item.title: What is Kim Yo Jong's exact role in North Korean politics?
item.description: Claims that Kim Jong Un's younger sister, Kim Yo Jong, is now the second-most powerful figure in North Korea and a potential successor to her brother are "exaggerated," a South Korean government minister said -- contradicting assessments by other top officials in Seoul.

item.title: Two teenagers left on one of the last flights out of Armenia. Now their parents are stranded
item.description: Arpy Kardashian sleeps with the phone under her pillow so she doesn't miss a call from her children. She's in Armenia, they're in Australia.

item.title: Revel returns mopeds to New York with safety changes after crashes
item.description: Revel mopeds will return to New York City Thursday, a month after safety concerns forced the company to pull its vehicles from city streets.

item.title: One of the FBI's Most Wanted Fugitives has been taken into custody
item.description: Yaser Abdel Said, one of the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives, has been "taken into custody without incident today in Justin, TX," according to a news release from the FBI Dallas Field Office.

item.title: Firefighters on leave after a woman thought to be dead was found breathing at a funeral home
item.description: Four Southfield, Michigan, firefighters are on paid administrative leave after a 20-year-old woman they pronounced dead was found breathing at a Detroit funeral home, according to officials.

item.title: US intel officials contradict Trump on foreign threats to mail-in voting
item.description: US officials charged with protecting the 2020 election said Wednesday they have "no information or intelligence" that foreign countries, including Russia, are attempting to undermine any part of the mail-in voting process, contradicting President Donald Trump, who has repeatedly pushed false claims that foreign adversaries are targeting mail ballots as part of a "rigged" presidential race.

item.title: He almost died migrating to Europe. Now he is warning others about it
item.description: Mustapha Sallah was in trouble.

item.title: Stephen Colbert pokes fun at night 2 of RNC
item.description: "The Late Show" host Stephen Colbert mocks Eric Trump, challenges Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and questions First Lady Melania Trump after night two of the Republican National Convention.

item.title: Central Park is unveiling a statue of women's rights pioneers. It's the park's first statue of real women
item.description: New York's Central Park is set to unveil a statue of women's rights pioneers Susan B. Anthony, Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Sojourner Truth -- marking the park's first statue of real-life women.

item.title: China puts hundreds of uninhabited islands up for rent
item.description: China's northeastern Liaoning province is home to hundreds of uninhabited islands -- and they're available to rent.

item.title: See convicted bank robber's reaction to learning he's been pardoned
item.description: Convicted bank robber and founder and CEO of Hope for Prisoners, Inc. Jon Ponder was issued a full pardon by President Trump. CNN's Kaitlan Collins has the details.

item.title: 'This is war!' How the relationship between Lionel Messi and Barcelona turned sour
item.description: Overnight, angry Barcelona fans descended on the Camp Nou to lay the blame at the feet of the man they hold responsible for Lionel Messi's desire to leave.

item.title: Britain's latest culture war is about a classical concert. Critics say racial justice is a bigger issue
item.description: They are two patriotic songs that, for decades, have been a staple of the final extravaganza in the "Proms" series of classical music concerts that bookends the British summer.

item.title: Cases falling nationwide in US, but rising in heartland
item.description: CNN's Nick Watt reports on coronavirus numbers state-by-state as some struggle to keep cases down, despite the US average falling below 1,000 new cases a day.

item.title: Elon Musk is now the fourth-richest person in the world. He's about to get even richer
item.description: Elon Musk just became the fourth-richest man in the world, according to Bloomberg. He's about to get a lot richer.

item.title: Trump's WeChat ban upset millions of users. But there's another drawback.
Body believed to be that of a missing Fort Hood soldier has been found
item.description: A body believed to be that of a missing Fort Hood soldier has been found.

item.title: Three-legged quarantine companion keeps family happy
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper shares viewers' stories about what makes them happy including a dog named Sebastian who beat cancer and a grandfather who cares for his granddaughter while her mother is working during quarantine.

item.title: Topless women defended by French government
item.description: It might not have the gravitas as liberté, égalité, fraternité, but the very French tradition of topless sunbathing has been defended as a vital freedom by a government official after a local police force tried to get a group of women to cover up.

item.title: RNC speaker was pulled after tweeting anti-Semitic conspiracies
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports that Mary Ann Mendoza, a proposed speaker at the Republican National Convention, has apparently been pulled from the lineup after she tweeted anti-Semitic conspiracy theories.

item.title: Bacteria from Earth can survive in space and could endure the trip to Mars, according to new study
item.description: A type of bacteria that is highly resistant to radiation and other environmental hazards survived outside of the International Space Station for three years, according to a new study.

item.title: 'It's like dating a guy that you know sucks,' says Serena Williams after loss
item.description: After relinquishing another lead and exiting the Western & Southern Open in the third round in New York, Serena Williams sounded a bit like 'Sex and the City' author Candace Bushnell, whose alter-ego Carrie Bradshaw chronicled the lives and loves of people she knew in the Big Apple.

item.title: 'Enola Holmes' movie trailer released on Netflix
item.description: Netflix has released a new trailer for the upcoming action comedy movie "Enola Holmes."

item.title: University creates student avatars for virtual graduation ceremony
item.description: As the coronavirus pandemic keeps affecting our lives, one university has come up with a unique way of awarding students their degrees, using virtual reality.

item.title: Pence makes last minute decision to address Wisconsin unrest
Sports stars's protests threaten to overshadow Pence's night at RNC
Barkley on NBA boycott: I've never seen anything like this
item.description: NBA commentator Charles Barkley reacts to the Milwaukee Bucks' decision to boycott their playoff game following the police shooting of Jacob Blake in the team's home state of Wisconsin.

item.title: Hear what Trump's family had to say about him at the RNC
item.description: President Trump's family took center stage at the RNC. Sons Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, daughter Tiffany Trump, and First Lady Melania Trump spoke about the President they know.

item.title: Teen arrested in Wisconsin protest shooting that left two dead
item.description: • Second video of Blake shooting surfaces • Why US police shoot so many times to bring down a suspect

item.title: 'Unsurvivable storm surge' threatens US as Laura explodes from Category 1 to 4 hurricane in 15 hours
item.description: • Storm tracker: See Laura's projected path

item.title: Fauci says he was in surgery when new CDC testing guidelines were discussed
item.description: White House Coronavirus Task Force member Dr. Anthony Fauci said he was in surgery and not part of the discussion during the August 20 task force meeting when updated US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidelines were discussed.
